intro: Clintonia nutans var. dasistema, commonly known as the nodding white bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped white flowers that hang downward. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and has lanceolate, dark green leaves. Its rhizomatous root system allows it to spread slowly and form colonies. The flowers bloom in early spring, adding a delicate floral display to forest floors.
